intro: Halimolobos henricksonii, commonly known as the Henry's halimolobos, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
